result.execSummary:
The defendant Santiago Marchan Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  Release for work, work search and treatment. Court grants 2 days credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs on must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

No contact with Waukesha Woodmans Store or victim listed in 22CM843.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment. 

Case 2022CM843 Dismissed and read in.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by Agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santiago Marchan Jr

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 11/03/2022, filed by Atty Kees, requesting an amendment to the sentence credit
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:03 PM Defendant Santiago Marchan Jr in court. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula with Attorney J Andrew Herbers supervising.  Attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Plea questionnaire indicated that the Defendant would be entering a guilty plea to count #1 of 22CM1254 and count #2 of 22CM843. Court conducted colloquy with the Defendant. Defendant made statements re: facts of case. Defense makes statements. Court was not going to proceed with plea/sentencing. State changes their offer during colloquy. Court proceeds with plea/sentencing. 

Defendant entered a guilty plea to count #1 ONLY. Court finds the Defendant guilty of count #1 ONLY. 
Count #2, 22CM843, and 22TR4241 are dismissed and read-in. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:

COUNT #1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS/RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH AND TREATMENT.  (Credit - 2 days).  

Term of Probation: 12 MONTHS 
**TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
No contact with: Waukesha Woodmans Store or victim listed in 22CM843.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
20 hours of community service 
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $243.00
DRGOD SURCHARGE: $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:50 AM Defendant Santiago Marchan Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsay Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula. Attorney Kees in court supervising. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense has received global offer, and requests to set for plea/sentencing hearing. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant Santiago Marchan Jr in court. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests a date in 30-60 days to receive offer on new case, and in order for the Defendant to be re-evaluated by the PD's office on new case. 
State will look into a global offer. 
Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
**Notice was not mailed as defendant's address is listed as homeless.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
**Notice was not mailed as defendant's address is listed as homeless.
**Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's Calendar.**
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Woodman's Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

01:58 PM Defendant Santiago Marchan in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
